sen.j: 竹内街道（たけのうちかいどう）は、大阪府堺市から東へ向かい、二上山 (奈良県・大阪府)の南麓・竹内峠を越えて、奈良県葛城市の長尾神社付近に至る約26kmの街道である。
sen.e: The 26-kilometer Takenouchi-kaido Road is a kaido (road) that heads east for the area around Nagao-jinja Shrine in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture from Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture through the south foot of Mt. Nijo-san (Nara Pref. and Osaka Pref.) and Takenouchi Pass.

The 26-kilometer Takenouchi-kaido Road is a kaido (road) that heads east for the area around Nagao-jinja Shrine in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture from Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture through the south foot of Mt. Nijo-zan (Nara Prefexture and Osaka Prefecture) and Takenouchi Pass.
sen.cmt: Mt. Nijo-zan (Nara Prefexture and Osaka Prefecture)に訂正しました。
sen.e: The 26-kilometer Takenouchi-kaido Road is a kaido (road) that heads east for the area around Nagao-jinja Shrine in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture from Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture through the south foot of Mt. Nijo-zan (Nara Prefexture and Osaka Prefecture) and Takenouchi Pass.

sen.j: 羽曳野市の白鳥交差点から葛城市の竹内集落付近までの区間は、そのほとんどの区域が国道166号に指定されている。
sen.e: Most section of the road between Shiratori crossing in Habikino City and Takenouchi Settlement in Katsuragi City is designated as National Route 166.
Most section of the road between Shiratori crossing in Habikino City and Takenouchi Settlement in Katsuragi City is designated as National Route 166.
Most section of the road between Shiratori crossing in Habikino City and Takenouchi Settlement in Katsuragi City is designated as National Route 166.

sen.j: 竹内街道は日本書紀の推古天皇二十一年（613年）の条に「難波より京（飛鳥）に至る大道（おおじ）を置く」と記されていた、日本最古の「官道」。
sen.e: According to the article about Emperor Suiko in 613 recorded in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the Takenouchi-kaido Road was a Japan's oldest "kando" (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) recorded as "a Ooji (road) was laid out from Nanba to the capital (Asuka)."

According to the article about Emperor Suiko in 613 recorded in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the Takenouchi-kaido Road was a Japan's oldest 'kando' (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) recorded as 'a Ooji (road) was laid out from Nanba to the capital (Asuka).'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: According to the article about Emperor Suiko in 613 recorded in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the Takenouchi-kaido Road was a Japan's oldest 'kando' (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) recorded as 'a Ooji (road) was laid out from Nanba to the capital (Asuka).'

sen.j: 現在の竹内街道は、大部分は推古天皇時代の官道と重なっている。
sen.e: The most of current Takenouchi-kaido Road overlaps with the kando in the period of Emperor Suiko.
The most of current Takenouchi-kaido Road overlaps with the kando in the period of Emperor Suiko.
The most of current Takenouchi-kaido Road overlaps with the kando in the period of Emperor Suiko.

sen.j: 東側は奈良盆地南部を東西に横切る官道横大路につながっている。
sen.e: The east side of the road is connected to the kando Yokooji that runs east and west of the south of the Nara Basin.
The east side of the road is connected to the kando Yokooji that runs east and west of the south of the Nara Basin.
The east side of the road is connected to the kando Yokooji that runs east and west of the south of the Nara Basin.

sen.j: かつては丹比道（たじひみち）と言われた。
sen.e: The road was called Tajihi-michi Road.
The road was called Tajihi-michi Road.
The road was called Tajihi-michi Road.

sen.j: 丹比野を横断するのでその名が付いたと推定されている。
sen.e: It seems it was because the road ran across Tajihino.
It seems it was because the road ran across Tajihino.
It seems it was because the road ran across Tajihino.

sen.j: 天武紀元年七月一日の条に「会明に、西の方を臨み見れば、大津・丹比、両の道より、戦の衆多に至る」とみえる。
sen.e: In the article about Emperor Tenmu, on July 1, 672, it is written that "when look down west at dawn, people were coming to the war from both roads of Otsu and Tajihi."
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・街道を通って戦に行くと理解しました。
sen.e: In the article about Emperor Tenmu, on August 2, 672, it is written that 'when look down west at dawn, people were coming to the war from both roads of Otsu and Tajihi.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。
sen.e: In the article about Emperor Tenmu, on August 2, 672, it is written that 'when look down west at dawn, people were coming to the war from both roads of Otsu and Tajihi.'

sen.j: 壬申の乱にも使われていたことが分かり、長尾街道と竹内街道であると推定されている。
sen.e: These roads were used for the Jinshin War and are considered to be Nagao-kaido Road and the Takenouchi-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: These roads were used for the Jinshin War and are considered to be Nagao-kaido Road and the Takenouchi-kaido Road.
These roads were used for the Jinshin War and are considered to be Nagao-kaido Road and the Takenouchi-kaido Road.

sen.j: この道は、古市古墳群と百舌鳥古墳群のほぼ中央部を走る東西道路である。
sen.e: The Takenouchi-kaido Road stretches west to east, running near the center between the Furuichi burial mounds and the Mozu burial mounds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Takenouchi-kaido Road stretches west to east, running near the center between the Furuichi burial mounds and the Mozu burial mounds.
The Takenouchi-kaido Road stretches west to east, running near the center between the Furuichi burial mounds and the Mozu burial mounds.

sen.j: 二つの古墳群を繋ぐ道路であったとも考えられる。
sen.e: It also considered being a road connecting these two burial mounds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It also considered being a road connecting these two burial mounds.
It also considered being a road connecting these two burial mounds.

sen.j: 長尾街道より遅れて敷設されたと考えられる。
sen.e: It was constructed after the Nagao-kaido Road.
It was constructed after the Nagao-kaido Road.
It was constructed after the Nagao-kaido Road.

sen.j: また、この街道を直線道路として東西に延長すれば誉田山古墳南端の後円部に、大山古墳の南東端部の前方部に接して通っていることになる。
sen.e: Also, if the road stretches west and east in a linear manner, it connects to the rounded part of the south of the Konda gobyoyama tumulus, and front part of the south east of the Oyama tumulus.
Also, if the road stretches west and east in a linear manner, it connects to the rounded part of the south of the Konda Gobyoyama Tumulus, and front part of the south east of the Oyama Tumulus.
sen.cmt: Konda Gobyoyama Tumulus, Oyama Tumulusに訂正しました。
sen.e: Also, if the road stretches west and east in a linear manner, it connects to the rounded part of the south of the Konda Gobyoyama Tumulus, and front part of the south east of the Oyama Tumulus.

sen.j: つまり、この二つの巨大古墳は地図上の北緯線上に造られていることが分かる。
sen.e: Therefore, these large burial mounds were constructed on line of north latitude on a map.
Therefore, these large burial mounds were constructed on line of north latitude on a map.
Therefore, these large burial mounds were constructed on line of north latitude on a map.

sen.j: 官道として整備されたのは上記の通り7世紀初め頃である。
sen.e: As mentioned above, the road was maintained as a kando in the early seventh century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As mentioned above, the road was maintained as a kando in the early seventh century.
As mentioned above, the road was maintained as a kando in the early seventh century.

sen.j: 二上山の西麓（現在の大阪府太子町 (大阪府)）には4世紀から5世紀にかけての陵墓・古墳などの遺跡が数多く残っているため、すでにかなりの人々の往来があったと思われる。
sen.e: From the fourth to fifth century, however, there are a number of remains such as imperial mausoleums and burial mounds in the west foot of Mt. Nijo-san, so it is considered that there were already many people passersby.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: From the fourth to fifth century, however, there are a number of remains such as imperial mausoleums and burial mounds in the west foot of Mt. Nijo-zan, so it is considered that there were already many people passersby.

From the fourth to fifth century, however, there are a number of remains such as imperial mausoleums and burial mounds in the west foot of Mt. Nijo-zan, so it is considered that there were already many people passersby.

sen.j: 飛鳥時代には、遣隋使の使節や留学僧が往来し、大陸から中国や朝鮮の文化をもたらし、飛鳥文化のいしづえとなった。
sen.e: In the Asuka period, kenzuishi (a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China) and priests who studied abroad traveled along the road to bring culture from the continent including Chinese and Korean cultures, which served as the foundation of Asuka culture.

In the Asuka period, kenzuishi (a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China) and priests who studied abroad traveled along the road to bring culture from the continent including Chinese and Korean cultures, which served as the foundation of Asuka culture.

In the Asuka period, kenzuishi (a Japanese envoy to Sui Dynasty China) and priests who studied abroad traveled along the road to bring culture from the continent including Chinese and Korean cultures, which served as the foundation of Asuka culture.

sen.j: 中世には伊勢街道の一部として存続し、現在では国道166号が通っている。
sen.e: In the medieval period, the Takenouchi-kaido Road continued as a part of the Ise-kaido Road and now the National Route 166 runs there.
In the medieval period, the Takenouchi-kaido Road continued as a part of the Ise-kaido Road and now the National Route 166 runs there.
In the medieval period, the Takenouchi-kaido Road continued as a part of the Ise-kaido Road and now the National Route 166 runs there.

sen.j: したがって竹内街道は飛鳥時代より現在に至るまで街道として利用されていることになる。
sen.e: Therefore, the Takenouchi-kaido Road is used as a kaido from the Asuka period until now.
Therefore, the Takenouchi-kaido Road is used as a kaido from the Asuka period until now.
Therefore, the Takenouchi-kaido Road is used as a kaido from the Asuka period until now.

sen.j: 江戸時代、沿道の竹内集落に松尾芭蕉が一時期住んでいた。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Basho MATSUO lived temporary in Takenouchi Settlement along the road.
In the Edo period, Basho MATSUO lived temporary in Takenouchi Settlement along the road.
In the Edo period, Basho MATSUO lived temporary in Takenouchi Settlement along the road.

sen.j: 現在、そこに芭蕉歌碑の綿弓塚があり、公園として整備されている。
sen.e: Currently, there is Basho's Watayumi tsuka (monument engraved waka poem) and maintained as a park.
Currently, there is Basho's Watayumi tsuka (monument engraved waka poem) and maintained as a park.
Currently, there is Basho's Watayumi tsuka (monument engraved waka poem) and maintained as a park.

sen.j: 経由地 （沿線施設等）
sen.e: Takenouchi-kaido Road route (facilities, etc. along the road)
Takenouchi-kaido Road route (facilities, etc. along the road)
Takenouchi-kaido Road route (facilities, etc. along the road)

sen.j: （西側から記述する）
sen.e: (Described from the west side)
(Described from the west side)
(Described from the west side)

sen.j: 堺市
sen.e: Sakai City
Sakai City
